replies.commentBody: Rick beck very true any move by Obama during the election would have looked very biased. At least he preserved all the intell he had . Now it's up to our leaders to bring this to and end before trump and his goons slip away .

comments.commentBody:
In retrospect President Obama's tact in handling this situation was appropriate and thoughtful. First of all it was bits and pieces of information that had yet to be compiled into any sort of hard evidence. Second it would have immediately been declared pure partisan hogwash intended to sway the election. Now that the election is complete and the information has been preserved the right can no longer ignore the implications by way of simple partisan acumen. How far it will go or what the result will be remains to be seen. There however can be no doubt that there is smoke in the air which means a fire is burning somewhere and that someone or maybe many someone's are responsible.

In order to present ourselves in the manner of a lawful democratic republic it is imperative that Sessions recuse himself from any ongoing inquiry and investigation. The Trump administration appears to be looking more and more like a mob run organization.

replies.commentBody:
Yes, Clinton lost the election because of her own actions. Yes, the US has meddled in other countries' elections. Yes, the CIA does wet work. Yes, we should keep diplomatic lines open even with enemy nations. Yes, Russia has nukes, but is overall a weak country. Yes, Russia has more at stake in Syria and the Ukraine than we do or Europe does.

No, it is not therefore ok that the Trump administration is in hock to Russia up to its eyeballs. No, it is not ok for Russia or anyone else to have compromising videos on the president. No, it is not ok for the president to have huge loans courtesy of Russia. No, it is not ok for the president to conduct foreign policy to grease the skids for his businesses. This man will fall, of his own hubris, and no nasty woman rhetoric will stop that.
No real evidence of video in Russia, compromising or not,  or huge loans exists.

comments.commentBody:
Russian hackers are so brilliant they knew exactly which actual emails of Ms. Clinton's associates (none refuted as forgeries) to release and on which day to cause Clinton voters, only in certain important states electoral college wise, to switch their vote to Trump, or stay home election day. All without causing even a single undecided voter to support Clinton.
The Clinton campaign spent over a billion dollars working to get people out to voter for her, only to be outdone by a hundred nerds in Russia. These brilliant hackers will be quickly hired as campaign managers for their prescience.
Or perhaps Ms. Clinton was a just a mediocre, although famous candidate, with many questionable decisions made during her career who did not inspire Democrats and independents to vote for her. Which caused her to loose the election.

t's a witch hunt!!

Obama's conduct akin to an African dictator.

But this time the stakes were less about self enrichment, and more about mass immigration, open borders and the dismantling of the nation state. Any politician in the western world who wishes to preserve the nation state - to continue to fly the American flag or the French, British, Dutch or German flag is facing accusations - from so-called intelligence reports - of colluding with Russia. It has been suggested that the UK Brexit vote outcome was somehow the work of Russia - and so needs to be investigated. As well as to put down opposition to Merkel's open door policy - migrant men are said to be directed by Putin to sexually assault German women - as in NYE Cologne.

It's the Soros plan - where national borders are believed to be obstacles, versus national sovereignty and the maintenance of national culture - such as Hungarian, Greek or German. A significant portion of the funding for these efforts is from Soros Open Society Foundation, a man who sold fellow Jews out to the Nazis in his native Hungary - and expects, promotes, funds mostly Leftist activist organizations to turn on their own countrymen, in this same order.

I predict this Russian intrigue will come to nothing. It only lets the Trump admin now how significant the Democrat lost was.

Funny. I seem to recall the '12 debate between Obama and Romney, where the Republican Candidate clearly laid out his fears on Russia and was mocked by Barry..."The '90's called, and they want their foreign policy back!"

replies.commentBody: Is this why the Democrats keep ignoring the lesson of the election that no one likes Clinton? They figure they'll impeach the whole Trump crew and try to get her in office again? News flash: the country preferred a cheating cheato to that candidate. Pick again.

comments.commentBody:
how much of the Kremlin 's increasingly likely interference in the US election was motivated by efforts to elect Trump, and how much was really directed against Clinton? It's pretty well know Putin considers her a major foe and blames her, personally, for anti-government protests in Russia back in, I believe, 2011.

Either way, it seems Putin has what he wanted: Clinton is sidelined and our current President is his puppet.

since major US banks, once or more burned and twice shy, we're not willing to lend Trump money for his Yuge projects worldwide, and to keep current on his Yuge debts (I love debt! I'm the king of debt!), is Trump in hock to Russia for billions?

"Follow the  money". The classic quote from Gov. Jerry Brown, so many years ago is more than timely at this present moment. Let's see those hidden Income Tax returns, not just for 2015, but for several past years.  Our present part time occupant of the White House has been in and out of Russia for many a year, trying to advance the monetary interests of his  privately owned Empire.  He continues to have that same aim.  The monetary interests of the country is of less concern to him and his den of theives.  Of course, it's obvious that Russia has been on his list of most favored nations.  Think of the monetary rewards he will reap once his business gets access to the Russian market place. Let's get a look at those returns.  The latest ones, can wait, let's see the prior ones that are not being audited.  Let's see if there is a "there, there".

This would seem bizarre, except for the fact that EPA information has been scrubbed from the web, has information from other departments coming off the web and access lost, this indicates that by putting political dept heads into jobs where they hate the department and want it destroyed, information will be 'lost.' NASA is another vital dept that is being cut and sliced into ineptitude.

It is incredibly stark that American scientists are having to pull down information and move it to a neutral country in order to save the information. You do not have to be a scientist to see that this Administration is the leader in the flat-earth and deny everything gang. That the Obama Administration saw far enough ahead to do this, speaks volumes of the information they gained, that they would suspect the info would be destroyed.

I cannot believe in my lifetime, that we have people fleeing to Canada to be safe. The movie, "Red Dawn" seems to be more and more likely under this Administration.

I hate to say - well not really - that I told you so ...... more than once.
My many times repeated Comment follows:

Trump ran for president - a great surprise to many.
He did so because he knew he could/would win.
His entire outrageous and offensive campaign, his demeaning attitude toward many groups of persons, and his blatant over-confidence/swagger were possible because he knew he could/would win.

The election is"rigged" he said.
Yes - most likely for him and not for HRC as he implied more than once.
"Rigged" he said. He and other overt and covert operatives may know this to be true.

The main task is to find out who they are and/or who they represented.
Who did it? Russia or GOP or Trump or two of them as a combination or all of them together as one determined "400 lb. unit - sitting on a bed" of their own making.

Why was Trump so determined to ignore, drop, slide over the entire issue of the hacking of pre-election elements.

To be considered is the hacking of the actual election in the compilation of the voting results received from all of the states.
Meeting predetermined results is possible in the computer software system designed to compile the final voting results in the aggregate.
77,000 votes spread over 3 states - is computer manipulation child's play.

Ask:
Can this act be labeled as high crimes or misdemeanor or even treason?
Win 2018 elections and then impeach in the House.

To me it seems that the Obama administration fell for the disinformation tactic that Trump would lose the election anyway, as he was too weak, and that it was not necessary to confront Putin.
This perceived weakness of Trump may also have resulted in Clinton wasting her energy the last few days before the election in trying to obtain a landslide victory, instead of simply trying yo win.
As I have commented before, history has shown many cases of such meddling in US elections by foreign adversaries.
After the denial, the next, difficult to answer question becomes: realising you have been duped, what are you going to do about it?

"No Drama" Obama has been a disappointment of MONUMENTAL proportions when it comes to taking the fight to Republicans, on many issues.

I am appalled that he did not make a huge public issue of Russian hacking in the 2016 elections.

How could he have assumed that would pass quietly? Of course it is a political story.

He would have been in an UNASSAILABLE position as a patriot to have raised this as soon as it was confirmed by multiple intelligence services. The stupidity of not having done so is beyond belief.

replies.commentBody: Pls bail out. You have your "facts" improperly construed. Take your ransom w you

Republicans can't adapt to change. If they have to cheat to avoid change, they will. If they have to lie, commit treason, trash the environment, overturn the constitution and sell our country to the Russians to avoid inevitable change, they will.

comments.commentBody:
Thinking back on the Watergate era, I recall that the American public (both Republicans and Democrats) were outraged at an incident that is far less significant than what is increasingly evidenced as Russian interference in our election, and Trump's and the Republicans' complicity in it.

In that era, we were talking about a burglary of a Democratic office done by petty thieves, albeit at the direction of those at the highest levels of government. This pales in comparison to the mounting evidence that Russians worked hand in had with the Republicans to throw our election.

The fact that relatively few Americans are outraged by this says a lot about what kind of nation this has become in the last forty years.

replies.commentBody: I don't think it's necessarily incompetence on the Vice President's part. Maybe it's more a case of what he doesn't know can't hurt him. Congressional Republicans (and Pence himself) have good reason to keep him "ignorant of who these people are"...

comments.commentBody:
By not acting like concerned Americans and stonewalling investigations, the House Republicans are only doing themselves more damage. From Bill Clinton's Ken Starr witch hunt, to President Obama's birth certificate, to Hilary Clinton's endless Bengazi and email server investigations, Republicans are reducing their credibility to zero. If there is nothing to hide it is better to do the investigation and close the issue once and for all. Otherwise, every policy decision this administration makes will be viewed as tainted.

The other problem with this administration is supposedly Vice President Pence was in charge of the transition, pooling together and vetting the list of high level cabinet appointees, yet suddenly he is walking around as if he was ignorant of who these people are. Either the swamp runs deep or the level of incompetence extends to the Vice President as well.

replies.commentBody: Let's be clear. Obama or Hillary?

replies.commentBody: Publis exactly where are his taxes

comments.commentBody: If Trump and his team have nothing to hide in-so-far as the Russians are concerned the appointment of a committee to conduct a special investigation would seem to be in his best interest.  If innocent one would think he would welcome the opportunity to shed some light on things.  The fact that his people continue to deny amidst revelations of contact that are verifiable only provides encouragement to Trump's detractors.  As was the case with Watergate, lies lead to more lies and it's the cover-up that will become the problem.

The left couldn't find the truth even if it was wrapped in a beautiful present on a Planned Parenthood doorstep. They continue to worship their fake news outlets and believe the sermons bashing Donald. Their prophets like Eric Holder is predicting the coming of Obama who will save them from all this grief. Yet it is this same man, their most holy 2-term president that has decimated their party, that they turn to for a resurrection from the political mayhem they find themselves.

Blindly, they nominate a presidential candidate with so much baggage that a NASA Apollo rocket wouldn't be able to lift it off the launch pad. The corruption oozes from Hillary and she erases all her illegal activities on an illegal private server while under a congressional subpoena. Her supporters cheer. Then her emails are hacked and the world discovers she has rigged the primaries against Sanders. Her supporters cheer. Trump pokes fun at Obama's intelligence agencies by saying suggesting the Russian's have the information. The left has spun this to make Trump and the Russians have hacked the election and his presidency is illegitimate. Again, Hillary's supporters cheer.

So bring it on Obama. Come forth with all your vengeance. Your attacks will be directed at Trump yet they will be based in falsehoods and lies. We will shine the lights of truth and your darkness will diminish. You destroyed the democrat party, now, lets put the final nail in the coffin.

replies.commentBody: I bet Flynn tried to deflect his Russian Ties too,..right up until he quickly quit and his boss let him.

Excuse me Elise - he may be your President and as such you can answer for him as this unfolds. We are not talking about an Obama "scandal" here, we're speaking of the President IN the White house today. The American people - Trump supporters and detractors - deserve to know what went on here. If he and his circle are innocent then they have absolutely nothing to hide. So far - especially given Flynn's performance (LIES) - they are looking a bit shifty to say the least. If I were you I'd want to know if the man I gave my confidence to was guilty. We sat thru how many weeks and millions of dollars spent (by Republicans) on Benghazi and found nothing worth the effort. Lets let this play out.
You might want to choose a peaceful, happy pic for your screen saver - say a photo of family, beloved pet or a fondly remembered landscape. You'll be happier and probably healthier.

Americans are still reeling from Obama's IRS Scandel, Benghzai Scandel, Fast & Furious Scandel, Spying on American Journalists including James Rosen, and the collapse of Obamacare.  Let me just say, Americans are not going to fall for this LAST attempt by Obama and Valerie Jarrett, Ben Rhodes, and gang to undermine our new President Trump.  My screen saver is the picture of the Obama staff in the Rose Garden the morning AFTER November 8.  Their smug smiles wiped clean from their smug faces that we endured for 8 years.  Mic dropped!

replies.commentBody: This kind of idiocy is jaw dropping.  There's evidence that the Russians have been interfering in the elections of European countries as well.  Are you going to blame that on President Obama?  Did President Obama force Trump's cronies to meet with the Russians?
Just substitute "Trump" for "Obama" and you would be correct.
This report went right over your head.

comments.commentBody: It is apparent to me that Obama is behaving as a traitor. He is giving aid and comfort to our enemies and has done so since he was in office. He is attempting to sabotage our lawfully elected president for unknown reasons. This behavior is called treason. He needs to be arrested and tried for his high crimes and misdemeanors. The factions in the intelligence community that are colluding with him need to be sought out and removed.  His actions are not being done to "save" the country, they are being done with the express purpose of causing damage to our nation. His actions are not honorable nor are they acceptable.l His lies regarding any Russian interference with the elections are becoming tiresome, but serve to justify an accusation of treason. It's time to bring Obama to justice.

In July 2008 , then candidate Obama travelled the Middle East and Europe, giving a historic speech in Berlin, to decry Bush era policy in Iraq, Afghanistan and elsewhere, at a time our country was at war. Polls were taken in Europe and European leaders expressed that they were enamoured of the democratic candidate.  Did anyone investigate whether the campaign met with any officials of foreign governments to discuss foreign policy , national security or  European cooperation or role in military matters particularly at a time of war? I  do not recall such press inquiries.  I am not questioning here the wisdom, clarity or logic of the currently debated Sessions ' responses under oath. That issue may be a different animal crawling on its own belly. The  issue here is what is the appropriate concern or inquiry even  if it were true  that the Trump campaign in some capacity met with some Russian officials. I , for one, don't believe the Russians had an electoral college strategy , so I have crossed that off the list of concerns. Short of the  Russians hacking voting machines or discovering someone from the campaign personally had a hand in directing Wikileaks disclosures, none of which is allegedwhat is the focused inquiry with regard to the election per se?

replies.commentBody: The Guardian did an excellent job with that article. I wish the Times and the Post would do more investigation into the Mercer family connections, and the manipulations carried out by Cambridge Analytics.

comments.commentBody:

It would appear that the Brexit result was manoeuvred by Cambridge Analytica and the Mercers.(Also gave a lot of money to Trump.)

There is much concern in France and Germany about hidden support for extreme right wing candidates .The Brexit result is very serious, destabilizing Europe. Trump's talk of NATO being useless is just what Putin likes to hear.
He'd like to see Both NATO and Europe greatly weakened .Then he'll be able to expand into Europe and invade . "Make Russia Great Again"

replies.commentBody:
Yo Chico,
Unless you regularly work to create corporate tax returns for multiple entities and have insider understanding of IRS tax law and rulings, the tax returns will only muddy the picture.

comments.commentBody:
Nixon said during Watergate, "People have got to know whether or not their President is a crook. Well, I'm not a crook. I've earned everything I've got." and now, it seems history is repeating itself.

In Trump's case, not only do the people need to know whether their President is a crook or not, but they also need to know if he's been compromised by the Russians.

It's interesting to hear certain Republican Senator's like Ted Cruz try to twist themselves into a pretzel to defend the lying of Jeff Sessions in his confirmation hearings regarding his meeting the Russian's during the convention, by saying the Democrat's are playing politics, this coming from the same man who said it would be acceptable to keep the Supreme court seat vacant for the 4 years of Hillary Clinton's term is she was elected.

Ted Cruz is a smarmy, sleazy excuse for a public servant and is an example of all the more reason that a special prosecutor and Watergate type committee is necessary and needs to be set up to completely look into exactly what the Trump campaign was doing in bed with Russia.

Instead of Trump being forthright, releasing all of his tax returns and investment records for the last 25 years to show he has no ties, conflicts of interest or indebtedness to Russian Oligarchs or Chinese banks, and prove he has nothing to hide, he's acting like a sleazy guilty man with everything to hide.

The Obama legacy is being revealed one deceitful leak at a time. Two terms of duplicity are leaving a lasting trail infiltrating the current administration with the dirty tricks of a party in freefall. Unable to continue a U.S. decline with a pantsuit-wearing, self-enriching, pay for play former Secretary of State, the stain of treachery nevertheless remains, attempting to taint a new corrected course illuminated brightly on Tuesday night.

As accolades reigned on the current President, the former now lurks in the shadows, stealthily filtering false stories to operatives in the press; begging the question: is the real threat the Russians or the collusion of the DNC and the American press?
C'mon New York Times finish the sentence.  Russian hacking" that uncovered cheating at the New York Times and CNN to disenfranchise Bernie Sanders.  They always leave that part out.

In the Obama administrations last days some White House Officials scrambled to spread information about possible contacts between associates of Trump and the Russians.

President Trump is correct, the Obama White House is behind the leaks of the Russian Hacking story.

We also learn the Obama administration was slow to grasp the extent of the Russians efforts. Not really surprising given Obama's message to Putin that in Obama's second term he would have more flexibility to make deals with the Russians. Remember Obama's mocking retort to Romney during one of their debates,"The 1980s called, they want their foreign policy back"? Remember the context of that retort? It was Romney's assertions that Russia was our greatest geopolitical foe.

Now after he was slow to grasp the Russian anti American efforts, Obama and his minions seek to spread a story that Trump is too friendly with the Russians, and the lap dogs in the media are chasing every stick thrown.

Now wonder an outsider like Trump won the Presidency. Americans are coming to grips with the failure of their political institutions and the Washington press, lo these past twenty years.

It's striking how effective Campaign Trump was in lowering the bar for President Trump.

The prejudice, true-believer-ism, self-interest and party first mentality infecting this country at the moment are fearsome in their impact and frightening in their effects.

We have no idea whether Trump, his campaign, his agents, rogue Republicans out to seal a victory, or anyone had direct, purposeful contact with the Russians.

We have no idea why Comey suffered a mental and ethical breakdown manifest as unthinking antipathy for Democrats and absolute disregard for his mission, his oath, the credibility of his agency, or the truth of what he was saying.

We really have no clue at all about the exact moment when 'Republican'
ceased to be a subset of 'American' and lit out on its own.

But we do have a clear picture that these things happened, that they had an important if not a deciding effect upon a Presidential Election, and that there is no one (CIA, FBI, Republicans, Democrats, House, Senate, Courts, Press) with the credibility to examine the situation and issue believable findings.

Worse, the American people seem fine with taking a quick peek and moving on.

That there is no mechanism to explore what happened in the face of system wide corruption and self-dealing indicates how very far we have strayed from an authentic American vision.

The founders never even conceived of a candidate, a party, or a voting public bereft of all good sense and patriotism.

replies.commentBody:
I would suspect, as with you and me, Trump and his operating companies paid the least they could.
Now, move on please.
